info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued April 15 at 1:39AM PDT until April 16 at 11:00AM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT FROM 8 PM THIS EVENING TO 11 AM PDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Wet snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 6 inches, except locally 8 inches above 4000 feet. * WHERE...Western Siskiyou County, including Highway 3 between Yreka and Fort Jones and also near Callahan. This also includes Sawyers Bar Road. * WHEN...From 8 PM this evening to 11 AM PDT Saturday. * IMPACTS..Travel could be difficult. Visibility will be limited at times. Snow could be wet and heavy, weighing down trees and power lines. Broken tree branches and power outages are possible. * ADDITIONAL DETAIL...The heaviest snow is most likely to occur from 10 pm Friday to 5 am Saturday, where rates could be one half to one inch per hour at times. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. * Carry tire chains and be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities. * See http://quickmap.dot.ca.gov for latest road conditions. * A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means that periods of snow will cause travel difficulties.
